items.sentence: I thought you said Tom would never hurt Mary.
I thought you two would have a lot in common.
Tom isn\'t the only one here who can do that.
Tom likes classical music, but Mary doesn\'t.
I don\'t know why you gave Tom so much money.
I don\'t like sitting in the back of the bus.
I don\'t like to talk about things like that.
I don\'t like you enough to want to date you.
Do you think I don\'t know what\'s happening?
Tom should\'ve done what Mary told him to do.
I\'ll mow the lawn tomorrow, unless it rains.
I\'m glad that you made it home in one piece.
I\'m taking my son to the zoo this afternoon.
I\'ve been trying to convince Tom to do that.
I debated whether to ask her about it or not.
I decided that I would quit my part-time job.
I did some work after breakfast and went out.
Our eyes take time to adjust to the darkness.
Our teacher speaks French as well as English.
People are singing and dancing in the street.
I want everybody to know I\'m not a murderer.
I\'m not going if you don\'t invite Tom, too.
Tom doubted that Mary would keep her promise.
Tom doubts if Mary will come to school today.
Tom drank the rest of what was in the bottle.
Children often cry just to attract attention.
Could I ask you to drive him to the hospital?
Could you give me your name and phone number?

Did Tom say anything to you before going out?
He said he would write to me, but he hasn\'t.
Tom didn\'t want to talk about what happened.
Tom doesn\'t care whether Mary stays or goes.
Tom doesn\'t like talking about his feelings.
Tom doesn\'t play golf as much as he used to.

Tom is dealing with a very difficult problem.
Tom is definitely not from this neighborhood.
Tom is definitely not going to be doing that.
Tom is definitely not in a joking mood today.
I suspected Tom was hiding something from me.
I think Tom is going to do something drastic.
I think Tom should be home with his children.
Did you find the things you were looking for?

Did you get the flowers I sent the other day?
Did you have something you wanted to tell us?
